snippet: The departure of Deborah Gramiccioni will be the start of the restructuring of the authority’s management after the lane-closing affair that entangled Gov. Chris Christie and several of his allies.
abstract: Deborah L Gramiccioni, deputy executive director of Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, announces she is stepping down; departure will kick off restructuring of leadership at Port Authority in wake of scandal over George Washington Bridge lane closings that has ensnared New Jersey Gov Chris Christie and his administration.
lead_paragraph: The departure of Deborah Gramiccioni will be the start of the restructuring of the authority’s management after the lane-closing affair that entangled Gov. Chris Christie and several of his allies.

headline.main: Port Agency’s Reorganization to Start With Exit of Executive Christie Picked
headline.print_headline: Port Agency’s Reorganization to Start With Exit of Executive Christie Picked

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
